page.title: 17Farming in Shoreham,Kent.
page.content:
Both{dairy}and{cereal}products are farmed in the valley.Mr. Hitchcock at Oxbourne Farm has 90 dairy cattle,90 beef cattle,and 100 sheep.Corn is the main cereal crop.
One speciality of the County of Kent is{hop growing.}Hops have been grown here for generations.The hops are dried in Oast Houses,a familiar sight in the Kent countryside.
{ Hops}are very susceptible to a disease called 'wilt'.It can be spread by rubber wellington boots,so hop farmers have to wear special plastic boots or dip their feet in a kind of disinfectant.
